subject: Re: [junit] Re: Problem with Method which is expected to throw 	message
msgSnippet: What happens if you run this? @Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class) public void testGetResult() throws Exception { Boolean result; try { result  =
messageBody:
What happens if you run this?

@Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class)
public void testGetResult() throws Exception {

Boolean result;

try {
result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
assertEquals("Should Return True", true, result.booleanValue());

result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
assertEquals("Should Return False", false,
result.booleanValue());

result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));

}
catch (Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
}

On Thu, Jun 10, 2010 at 2:03 AM, raja_s_patil <kpr.rspatil@...> wrote:
> Thanks For help,
>
>>
>> You need to change the signature of your public void testGetResult() to include throws Exception, like so:
>>
>> public void testGetResult() throws Exception {
>>
>
> I have changed as Follows
>
>        @Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class)
>        public void testGetResult() throws Exception {
>
>                Boolean result;
>
> //      try {
>                result  = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
>                assertEquals("Should Return True", true, result.booleanValue());
>
>                result  = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
>                assertEquals("Should Return False", false, result.booleanValue());
>
>                result  = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
>
> //      }
> //      catch (Exception e) {
> //      e.printStackTrace();
> //      }
>                }
>
> but the test ends with following fault and bar is still RED.
> with comment on last 'result = ' statement the bar turns GREEN
> I expect that when exception is not raised the test should fail.
>
>
> java.sql.SQLException: Could not convert '' to a boolean value. Valid arguments are 'T' and 'F'.
